.@MazzucatoM to avoid a depression: 'We need policies that are not only reactive but also strategic, bringing us closer to an investment-led global Green New Deal. Bold plans to create carbon-neutral cities & regions could foster creativity & innovation'  https://t.co/Loe7woJZLN

We need new ways of reducing waste. A deposit refund scheme for bottles & cans would be a good start. We can require other packaging to be biodegradable & introduce municipal bins for such compostable material. We can then end single use & non recyclable plastics. #wastereduction https://t.co/pTTtTKPfXX
I spoke with @SarahAMcInerney this morning about leadership elections within the Green Party and programme for Government talks. @TodayRadioRTE https://t.co/qJArweTcQI

Bad news for fans of @leinsterrugby @Munsterrugby @UlsterRugby  @connachtrugby as more games are likely to go behind pay walls. Selling out to private broadcasting has killed the game in other countries. Shame that @IRFURugby are going the same way. #Rugby https://t.co/ZBTHLxKjPJ
If we get this right I think we could see a ten-fold increase in cycling in our city this summer. #Onyourbike https://t.co/NxJ7td64II

'Generate a sense of national purpose. Set up rigorous monitoring of, and accountability for, very specific targets. Embrace the economic opportunities. Give communities ownership. Keep civil society and businesses engaged.' @fotoole #ClimateActionNow https://t.co/tzuOMQ08aM

Our President Michael D Higgins @PresidentIRL said that the document should be seen as a Whitaker for our times, he said: "It is the map for our recovery and we should be wise enough to use it". https://t.co/nIS0ymfseX

I gave a speech in the Dáil last week referring to this report - https://t.co/OTJf80HAEj - from the @NESCIreland on how we can achieve a just transition in Ireland for both the digital and low carbon economy. https://t.co/Z3mnmuPVgN
We could do this too. By acting fast we could put in interim on-street measures, creating safe cycling routes as people return to work. #SocialDistancing #solutions https://t.co/4SYoPpRm3n
Huge potential for Ireland. https://t.co/Qo0JlHntnr

"The choice is not between purity and perfection, it is between action and inaction. We simply cannot afford to wait another five years to ramp up climate action. Every day counts now. Every tonne of emissions counts,” @OisinCoghlan https://t.co/PFqJpEKCuD

At long last, after years of campaigning for it by @dublincycling a contra-flow cycle lane is going into Nassau Street. First section to Kildare St open now, link to Dawson Street on the way. #Hallelujah #dublin #cycling https://t.co/wT1AdzQMSg

Meanwhile the planetary temperature continues to rise. https://t.co/HYHi6SUIar
What a loss to the world and how much he left behind, by exploring, mapping and recounting the stories from our land.  https://t.co/UfBOnOtnb5

Big increase in bed capacity to #FlattenTheCurve. 2300 public hospital beds now available & 2000 contracted from private hospitals. 450 overflow beds in Convention Centre & 1100 bed isolation centre in CityWest, with others due to open. Still too early to know if it'll be enough. https://t.co/x3s86kUN7g

Increased testing delayed by world wide shortage of 'reagent' supplies. Other sources now being examined. Testing will be most vital when we start loosening control measures post a peak in infections. We will then try to control further outbreaks without using shutdowns. #COVID19 https://t.co/6NGGFoMZwN

At latest #COVID19 conference via video link to Govt. buildings. Still too early to call effect of self isolation measures due to time lags but reproduction rates are falling & the number of traced contacts from someone infected has reduced from an average 20 down to 3. #keepitup https://t.co/bWlbyTItID
Go on Pauline. https://t.co/RQnXd1RloQ
Well done Pippa. https://t.co/TjFALaSRBC

So sorry to see @saoirse_mchugh miss out on a seat at the last count. Her vision for a better future for rural Ireland will be missed in #Seanad2020 but I'm sure there will be other ways it will be heard. She did so much for the @greenparty_ie in the last year. Thank you Saoirse. https://t.co/yNlTFn35CW

Our country does need strong and stable Government at this remarkable time. From talking to other Party leaders I believe we can  all work together to provide exactly that. #unityisstrength #Ireland https://t.co/VQtW0knt8r

.@BillGates speaking with real  knowledge about how we take on the #coronavirus 'Our genorisity has to go up to others, at the same time as we are less physically interacting with people.' #COVID2019 https://t.co/DmNf00eA9Y
@mattwridley 0 Edh

Key message from @CMOIreland at briefing with party leaders this afternoon: Anyone with #COVID19 symptoms, contact your GP to see if you need a test, assume it will be positive & self isolate at home straight away. Ask your fellow householders to do the same. #StayAtHomeSaveLives https://t.co/wLL115sCIL

A critical element in our own strategy to suppress the coronavirus with be the isolation of those infected but who have only with mild symptoms, either at home or more ideally in community isolation facilities. https://t.co/9dZRFE9AHP
Dail Eireann is debating the introduction of emergency #coronavirus legislation now. You can watch live via https://t.co/3iwcmIjNXY #covid19ireland #Coronavirusireland https://t.co/sVJjsexepK
Happy St Patrick's Day with some Social distancing on Sandymount Strand. #covid19Ireland #coronavirus #LaFheilePadraig https://t.co/qNtsI0XSgq
A useful slidedeck from an Associate Professor of neurobiology at Stanford, to share facts and predictions about #COVID19 and the #coronavirus. https://t.co/T1nDyhlF2z

Briefing this evening from @HSELive  & @CMOIreland on latest #Coronavirusireland plan. Contact tracing staff increasing from 60 to 800. Community testing to ramp up with centres for those infected but not very ill to open, so hospitals are not over run. Unprecidented challenge. https://t.co/TdVFFmgQmU

A meeting of Dail party leaders took place today to review the measures being taken in response to the #coronavirus crisis. We will continue to meet regularly to access what can be done to minimise the threat to our people. We are united in supporting our public health officials. https://t.co/3YlFoNUkVZ

@GregcraigGreg @DeirdreConroyIE @cardagh @OCallaghanJim @MurphyEoghan @Costellop @DubCityCouncil @ILoveTerenure @RathgarResident @parishofzion can you send more detailed location to eamon.ryan@oireachtas.ie. From the photo I presume it is at Bushy Park section of the river.

I defended mainstream media at a recent @OxfordUnion debate. More than ever we need good quality journalism and public service broadcasting to help inform public opinion and counter #disinformation & #FakeNews. https://t.co/JgTR9fUTCW
Here is the speech I gave in Dail Éireann last night following the votes for nomination of Taoiseach: https://t.co/t0fheVJ5GS

We've invited other parties into bilateral talks to consider six questions. How do we deliver real change in climate, health and housing? How do we fund the change? What's the All island/Brexit/EU dimension & how do we build strong communities as we go?  https://t.co/44ajJHrrcN

We had our first meeting of our new Parliamentary Party today. We have a great new team and will be doing what we said we will do during the campaign, by starting to talk to other parties in the next few days. #33rdDail @greenparty_ie https://t.co/CIkleLir9z

. @FNDuffy is our 11th green td elected for the 33rd Dail. It is a great day for our party. #GE20202 @greenparty_ie https://t.co/fbZCjWSBhT
It will go down to the wire but hoping Steven can make it twelve green seats. https://t.co/mirr5Hm7Xe

Parents in Dublin 4/6/6W came together tonight to campaign for integrated school places for their autistic children. When we put special units within our schools everyone gains, as all students learn empathy in working with each other. #OurChildrenMatter https://t.co/dkZYLOelM9 https://t.co/IBtSePWSED

Neil Hannon of the Devine Comedy kicks off our monster canvass from outside Suffolk with a song. Proud that our team will get to knock on every available door in #DublinBaySouth. #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/jKP5UibHSv

'However, there is a growing chasm between how serious the party is taking the issue and the apparent disregard of three big parties for tackling what is officially designated as an emergency.' #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/wVEBxZezJu

“Mayo needs a 50-year plan,” she says. “Young people are leaving. It does not have to be that way at all. We can bring life back into the towns and villages and stop people driving long distances.” @saoirse_mchugh #WantGreenVoteGreen #GE2020 https://t.co/P3cP6IUmVD
I'd the pleasure of talking to Eamon Dunphy today about #GE2020 https://t.co/zU1xDzoVTY
